Description: Green glazed composition shabti of Satmes(?), divider of the two gods, with a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face with ears and a plaited beard and parallel hands in relief holding an adze, a hoe and the string of the seed-basket that hangs over the shoulder; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of incised Hieroglyphs; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Satmose (?;garbled for Thutmose ?)
